DOC.brief_title: Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure ( n-CPAP ) Versus Nasal Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure ( n-BiPAP ) RDS
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim study compare impact early extubation nasal continuous positive airway pressure ( n-CPAP ) versus nasal Bilevel positive airway pressure ( n-BiPAP ) need mechanical ventilation via endotracheal tube ( MVET ) 7 day age less preterm infant < 34 week ' gestation require intubation surfactant indicate respiratory distress syndrome within 60 min delivery . Second aim compare different outcome post-extubation n-CPAP n-BiPAP .
